subject: Travel
title: Ibn Battuta: The Greatest Traveler
description: A short lesson to help you apply Ibn Battuta: The Greatest Traveler.

hook.text: In 1325, a 21-year-old Moroccan left home for Mecca. He didn't return for 29 years.

buildup.text: Ibn Battuta traveled 75,000 miles across Africa, Asia, and Europe â€” three times farther than Marco Polo.

discovery.text: He visited 44 modern countries, served as a judge in India, and survived shipwrecks and bandits.

twist.text: When he finally returned to Morocco, the sultan ordered him to dictate his story before he forgot.

climax.text: His book, the Rihla, is the most detailed travel account from the medieval world.

punchline.text: The world's greatest traveler almost forgot to write it down.

quiz.question: How far did Ibn Battuta travel?
